message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to discuss the product with you. I think it's a great opportunity for you to get a unique item. I'm willing to offer it to you for $120.
Alice, I appreciate your offer, but $120 is still out of my price range.  I'm willing to pay $85 for it.
I understand that $120 was a bit steep, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer it to you for $110. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really enjoy the product.
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $110 is still a bit too high.  I'm firm at $85.  If you're not willing to come down to that, I'll have to look elsewhere.

I understand that you're firm at $85, but I'm not willing to sell it for that low. I'm willing to compromise and offer it to you for $100. It's still a great deal, and I think you'll really enjoy the product.
Alice, I appreciate your compromise, but I'm still only willing to pay $85.  This is a fair price for both of us.  Let's meet in the middle.

I understand that you're trying to meet in the middle, but I'm still not willing to sell it for $85. I'm willing to make one more compromise and offer it to you for $95. It's the lowest I'm willing to go, but I think it's still a fair price for both of us.
Alice, I appreciate you coming down in price. $95 is still a bit higher than I'm comfortable with.  I'm going to offer $90, and I hope we can finally reach an agreement.

I'm getting close to my minimum price, but I'm still not willing to sell it for $90. I'm willing to make one more compromise and offer it to you for $92. It's the last chance I'm giving you to make a deal.
